div.sent: We know that body of human being consists of more than one cell.
However there are one-celled animals and plants as well.
A cell is a minute one in form and size.
It is so small that it can not be seen with naked eyes.
So microscope is essential to see a cell.
Cells of all organisms are not similar.
The cells are of different sizes.
According to the diversity of living organisms the living cells are of different sizes.
Again according to functions, the shape of the cell becomes different.
As for example the shape and size of hepatic cells are different from those of pulmonary cells.
A small insect or a large animal such as an elephant or a large banyan tree etc are made from a single cell.
Certainly you are now interested to know how a large plant or a large animal are created from a tiny cell.
During sexual reproduction a sperm and an ovum together form a zygote.
The living body is formed by the divisions of the zygote.
In this way, through repeated divisions of cells, body of the living organism is developed and a mature body is built up.
The process by which a living cell produces two or more new cells is called cell division.
The cell which produces new cells through division is called mother cell.
The new cells which are produced as a result of cell division of mother cell are known daughter cells.
In brief, it may be said that the process by which daughter cells are produced from mother cell is called cell division.
So we could understand that due to cell division body of living organism increases.
Along with the growth of living body, development of embryo, metabolic activities, reproduction etc takes place through cell division.
In all living bodies two main types of cell divisions are found, such as- mitotic cell division and meiotic cell division.
Mitotic cell division: We have come to know in class- VI that nucleus is present inside a cell and chromosomes are there in the nucleus.
Chromosomes bear the characteristic features of the organism.
In the mitotic cell division the number of chromosome remains equal in mother cell and also in daughter cells and they are of same quality.
After mitotic cell division, the daughter cells inherit the same characteristics.
Thus this process of cell division is also known as cell division of similarity.
Mitotic division takes place mainly in the body cells of living organism.
In the process of mitosis main division takes place in the nucleus though this division is understood as the division of full cell.
Division of nucleus: Nucleus becomes larger in size at the begining of the division of a body cell.
At the same time nuclear reticulum becomes prominent.
(B) Division of Cytoplasm: Centering the daughter nucleus cytoplasm is divided.
At this stage cytoplasm of dividing cell surrounds the daughter nucleus by being divided into two.
At first stage a fissure is formed in the cell membrane in the middle of the cell.
Gradually this fissure becomes deep.
In this way cytoplasm is divided into two resulting in two daughter cells.
Importance of Mitotic cell division: Embryo is fromed from zygote and mitiosis is important for the development of embryo.
In this process of cell division, the number of cell increases.
In this way the body of plants and animals grows.
Meiotic cell division : Meiotic cell division always occur during the formation of reproductive cells from reproductive mother cells.
The number of chromosomes of the reproductive cell, which is formed by this division, becomes half the number of chromosomes of mother cell.
The number of chromosomes same as the mother cell in the newly formed cell resulted from the fusion of such two reproductive cells.
This fused two cells together is called fertilized egg or zygote.
As a result of cell division by meiosis the number of chromosomes of an organism remains constant generation after generation.
The characteristic of meiotic cell division is that the nucleus divides twich.
Importance of meiosis : The living organisms in which sexual reproduction occurs, their reproductive cells are formed by this process.
By this process of cell division the number of chromosomes in each organism remains constant and daughter cells are created with new characteristics.
